title: I'm A Celebrity winners 'have to give trophy back' after filming
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

I’m A Celebrity… Get Me Out Of Here! winners have to ‘give back their trophy’ after being named champions and when the cameras stop rolling.

According to McFly’s Dougie Poynter, the champs of the show have to return their accolade after posing for pictures and walking across that infamous bridge to meet their loved ones.

Speaking to Simon Rimmer and Tim Lovejoy on Sunday Brunch alongside his band members the singer, who was named King of the Jungle back in 2011, admitted that he no longer has his iconic staff or wreath.

‘You have to give that back,’ Dougie said. ‘As soon as they cut and say you won, they’re like, “Yeah, we’ll take that back now thanks”.’

We truly thought the likes of Harry Redknapp and Scarlett Moffatt had their award on display in their living rooms. Gutted.

Doguie won the show back in 2011 (Picture: Rex Features)

I’m A Celeb winners don’t get to keep their staff (Picture: Rex)

Dougie’s band member Harry Judd also confirmed the same happens on Strictly Come Dancing with the Glitterball Trophy.

‘It’s like the Glitterball as well,’ he added. ‘They give you the big one and then they take it straight off you and give you this tiny little one.’

‘That’s why I didn’t bother winning it,’ Simon joked.

Former EastEnders star Kara Tointon, who won the Sport Relief special edition of Strictly in 2008 after she danced the samba with Mark Ramprakash before going on to win the main show in 2010, revealed that her miniature gong has fallen apart.

She added: ‘My one is now a cardboard ball because the mirror thing has come off, so it’s not very impressive anymore.’

Strictly recently returned to the BBC with I’m A Celebrity due to make a comeback later this year.
